definition: to withhold information/to keep sth secret
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

sentences.english: True faith in God cannot be kept secret.
sentences.chinese: 真心信神是无法秘而不宣的。

sentences.english: Why can't we talk about miscarriage? Who is hurt by keeping the topic taboo?
sentences.chinese: 令这个话题秘而不宣会使谁受到伤害呢？

sentences.english: Eight years ago, it was shut down in a tacit admission that the US was ceding the market to China.
sentences.chinese: 八年前，美国秘而不宣地将市场拱手让给中国。

sentences.english: But the slaughter went unreported in that closed society.
sentences.chinese: 屠杀在封闭的社会里秘而不宣。

sentences.english: Relations between the two groups are often enveloped in secrecy.
sentences.chinese: 这两个团体之间的关系常常秘而不宣。

sentences.english: This whole notion of the company as a fortress, where all information is kept away from prying eyes, is changing.
sentences.chinese: 公司作为一切秘而不宣信息的堡垒的观念正在改变。

definition: important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
to refuse to say anything about (idiom)/to remain tight-lipped/to avoid mentioning
lit. to guard one's mouth like a closed bottle (idiom); tight-lipped/reticent/not breathing a word
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
known by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
not to mention (idiom); to say not one word/fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
